intro: Mulgedium alpinum, commonly known as the alpine mulgedium, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Mulgedium alpinum is often found in mountain meadows and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions. Its botanical features make it an important component of alpine ecosystems.
